data.title: Cedarcroft Home
data.text:
A HOME FOR MEN IN LEBANON, TENNESSEE

Cedarcroft Home, Inc. is a facility dedicated to the care and welfare of the mentally handicapped, disadvantaged and homeless men. Established in 1974 and licensed in 1996 with the Tennessee Department of Mental Health and Retardation, Cedarcroft strives to meet all state and local regulations to provide the safest environment for its residents.

We offer room and board with three nutritious meals a day plus evening snacks. Residents receive indirect supervision of medication, medical service referrals & transportation, laundry services, activity opportunities and much more!

Cedarcroft is home to 136 men in our main buildings and independent living facilities. We have round-the-clock staff on site to assist our residents. We also have a medical doctor, psychiatrist and psychologist who treat and evaluate the residents on a regular basis.

We offer a variety of living skills for the men to participate in and encourage them to get involved in various areas as they choose.

We are pleased to say that our residents are offered many extras not normally found in other boarding facilities of this nature.
